Delicious Mexican food in this authentic gem of a restaurant. The area is a bit sketchy but that's how you know there's good food. Everything I've tasted has been delicious and authentic, from the nachos and the GAC, to the tacos, handmade tortillas and tamales, to their horchata. Truly a treat to have. The atmosphere is hole in the wall dive bar vibes. The staff are friendly and attentive. Portions are generous.

The worst experience I‚Äôve had in any restaurant and honestly the first time I‚Äôve ever been racially profiled. I am a darker Hispanic man ( PR & Cuban) & I came in the other day with my wife to pick up some dinner ( steak tacos & enchiladas etc) and the food total came out to about $50 or so. I was then surprised to hear that I had to give my STATE ID along with my card in order to pay, keep in mind I had not ordered any alcohol nor was the total over $100. My wife is Hispanic so she understands Spanish fluently and overheard the ladies at the counter whispering about me saying ‚Äú I needed to be watched ‚Äú and was followed by constant weird stares. I‚Äôve never heard of having to provide ID for $50 worth of food. The people at the counter even asked for my ID again to ‚Äúverify my name‚Äù and such on. I am beyond disgusted with that treatment and will never step foot into that establishment again. If you are a person of color I warn you that you will be treated with the same courtesy as I did.

The most unprofessional, rude and nastiest attitudes from receptionist on the phones. My SIL called to complain about incorrect order and they blocked her and my brother‚Äôs number. I attempted to make an order over the phone as usual with my card payment, rude waitress told me to wait and call back. I tried to explain if their machine is down, i can pay cash. She hung up the phone. I tried calling , she answered the phone and hung up. Tried calling 3 more times after and keep getting my calls forwarded AFTER giving my card info. Now i have to cancel my card. So rude!!!! Nastiest attitude. Get new workers that are happy to take calls. And for future references, lower the radio you have blasting like a club. Yall have nasty attitude when we ask to repeat what yall say because the music is so loud. Do yall want to be a club or a restaurant?
The owner is very rude and he have no class when he talks to the customers not recommended

Food was not bad at all but it's not to die for neither.Services was express that shocked me but i would had love waiting a little long for a tasty food!! Their Sauce (guacamole) is to die for it has all the right flavor you taste on a real guacamole.

!Perfecto! It's been hard finding truly awesome Mexican. I find one and it goes out of business. Or it becomes too popular and Americanized. Los Hermanos Salazar is great. It's a pretty small place and the food prep is a bit slow, but worth the wait. Also, ciento, no inhaled (sorry, no English) - either speak Spanish or do your best to point in the translated menu.

We had six tacos of lengua (beef tongue), tripa (tripe), al pastor (spicy pork with pineapple), and barbacoa (bbq goat). All were excellent, although they needed the cheese for salt. Plenty of filling and toppings with radish on the side. We ordered a large side of arroz y frijoles (rice and beans), and while it was huge, we cleaned house. Honestly, one of the best we've had. Very simple but executed with perfection.

Finally, my favorite, a cemita con mixto de lengua y cabeza (a large sandwich with beef tongue and head). Filled a plenty with chipotle, avocado, lettuce, tomato, mayo and more. I had it without cheese. The bread was awesome. The sandwich was huge and awesome. I'm still full.

This is worth a Bronx trip. For a family of four hungry eaters, the meal as described plus a few seltzer and a generous tip was $54. Wow.

First time trying this place and they did not disappoint. The tostadas and tacos were very delicious. The tacos were stuffed, other taco places are cheap on the toppings but not them. The salsas were perfectly spicy too. They weren't‚Ä¶
The Al Pastor tacos were well seasoned, spicy and delicious.

I ordered from here today. The food was cold..Seems like it sat in the restaurant for a while before they sent it. The nachos were soggy, steak was dry. It had too much sour cream and onions, which I requested them not to put in the food.‚Ä¶
Amazing place. The food never disappoints. Good and humble people. Service is always great. Tacos are on point, but then again, any dish they make is delicious.
